intro: Sophronanthe hispida, commonly known as the rough sophronanthe, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. Sophronanthe hispida is often found in dry forests and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat.
